metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20650 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A reachable Object::dictLookup assertion in Poppler 0.72.0 allows attackers to cause a denial of service due to the lack of a check for the dict data type, as demonstrated by use of the FileSpec class (in FileSpec.cc) in pdfdetach.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.11').
